nodes.text: An IoT based home automation system can provide low cost, wireless remote control of home appliances, improve energy efficiency and accessibility, and be scalable and secure
Design and implement a prototype Home Automation System (HAS) that integrates appliances into an interconnected network controllable via internet or automatically by ambient conditions

Primary objectives: automate control of every appliance, provide switch and voice control modes, show device status in an app, support control from any WiFi capable device, and ensure scalability for adding functions and devices
The prototype implementation is intended to be economical, simple, expandable, and suitable for homes, small offices, and shopping centers
Context: Prior work demonstrates IoT based smart home controllers using NodeMCU or Raspberry Pi, voice integration with Google Assistant, MQTT brokers, and energy management algorithms
Method: Hardware components used include Arduino UNO R3, Bluetooth module HC05, relay module, printed circuit board, wires, power supply, and WiFi for connectivity

Method: Software components and architecture use Android client app that sends data via socket programming, parses voice intents from Google servers, and communicates with the microcontroller over WiFi
Assumption: Using devices with WiFi and Android platform enables flexible remote control and status monitoring of appliances through the app
Result: The prototype provides a wireless remote switching system using WiFi with an indoor range of approximately 150 feet
Result: The application supports two control modes: switch mode (radio buttons toggling appliance state) and voice mode (microphone sends voice to Google servers, receives string, parses commands)
Method / Claim: The system implements secure connections for appliance control using SSL over TCP and SSH

Evidence / Result: The prototype displays device status in the smartphone app, allows on/off commands via switches and voice, can be controlled from any WiFi connected device, and is presented as economical and expandable

Conclusion: The developed IoT based prototype meets the project objectives by enabling remote and voice control, status monitoring, WiFi based access, security measures, and offers a scalable, low cost solution for home automation
Limitation: The prototype description lacks quantitative evaluation of energy savings, user studies for accessibility benefits, and detailed performance metrics beyond an stated 150 foot indoor range
